RACE.RACE_TEXT: FORT ERIE RACE 1 5F Dirt CR: 78. Allowance Purse 24600. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Other Than Claiming Since September 16 Allowed 2 lbs. (Colts And Geldings Preferred)(*Plus Up To $4,725 Ontario Bred/Ontario Sired Breeders Awards).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: I LIVE BY FAITH stalked the early leader, dueled on the turn and with the lead from the four path at the top of the stretch proved best. ROLLING HILLS was unhurried early, moved up on the turn and from the five path at the top of the stretch was second best. JUSTIN'S WAY was away alertly and raced evenly on the turn but from the four path at the top of the stretch had no late kick. M C JACKHAMMER stumbled at the start and saved ground on the turn but had no rally. RELOAD BULLET was off slow and had a slim lead on the turn but gave way at the top of the stretch.

ENTRY.NAME: Reload Bullet
ENTRY.COMMENT: off slow, slim lead turn, gave way

ENTRY.NAME: M C Jackhammer
ENTRY.COMMENT: stumbled start, saved ground turn, no rally

ENTRY.NAME: I Live by Faith
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked leader, dueled turn, led 4-path stretch, proved best

ENTRY.NAME: Justin's Way
ENTRY.OWNER: Leith Scott Zaniol Dean and Fournier Mark
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, evenly turn, 4-path stretch, no late kick

ENTRY.NAME: Rolling Hills
ENTRY.COMMENT: unhurried early, moved up turn, 5-path stretch, 2nd best

RACE.RACE_TEXT: FORT ERIE RACE 2 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 75. Claiming Purse 13500. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON A RACE IN 2023 OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $4,000 (Colts And Geldings Preferred)(*Plus Up To $540 Ontario Bred/Ontario Sired Breeders Award s).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: LOQUACIOUS settled off the early pace, was roused on the turn and from the seven path at the top of the stretch was up in time. BOUND LUCKY tracked the early leaders, was a factor on the turn and had a bid from the five path in mid stretch but was outgunned. CRUMLIN EXPERIENCE was off slow, had a good position on the turn and from the four path at the top of the stretch was up for show. BOCELLI forced the early pace and had a slim lead on the turn but from the three path at the top of the stretch had nothing left. BIG BROWN BREWSKII was in touch early but trailed the field on the turn and was not a factor. RADCLIFFE set a pressured pace but chased on the turn and dropped back through the stretch.

ENTRY.NAME: Big Brown Brewskii
ENTRY.COMMENT: in touch, trailed turn, not a factor

ENTRY.NAME: Crumlin Experience
ENTRY.COMMENT: off slow, good position turn, 4-path stretch, up for show

ENTRY.NAME: Radcliffe
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pressured pace, chased turn, dropped back stretch

ENTRY.NAME: Bocelli
ENTRY.COMMENT: forced pace, slim lead turn, 3-path stretch, nothing left

ENTRY.NAME: Bound Lucky
ENTRY.OWNER: Beharry Vinodh H and Ceccato Sharon
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked leaders, factor turn, bid 5-path stretch, outgunned

ENTRY.NAME: Loquacious
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled off pace, roused turn, 7-path stretch, up in time

RACE.RACE_TEXT: FORT ERIE RACE 3 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 71. Claiming Purse 15750. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since September 16 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,750, allowed 2 lbs. (Races Where Entere d For $4,000 Or Less Not Considered In Allowances) (*Plus Up To $540 Ontario Bred/Ontario Sired Breeders Awards).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: TICKLE HER TOE was in touch, a factor on the turn and from the five path at the top of the stretch fought gamely for the win. SO BREANNA forced the early pace, dueled on the turn and vied through the stretch in a good effort. HONEY GIRL set the pace and had a slim lead on the turn but from the four path a the top of the stretch was outfinished. MS SUEDOO was unhurried early, roused from the inside on the turn and from the four path at the top of the stretch was up for a share. SMARTY ILLUSION settled off the pace and raced evenly on the turn but from the six path at the top of the stretch needed more. CEDAR VALLEY reared at the start and moved up on the turn but from the seven path at the top of the stretch was empty.

ENTRY.NAME: Ms Suedoo
ENTRY.COMMENT: unhurried early, roused inside turn, 4-path stretch, up for share

ENTRY.NAME: So Breanna
ENTRY.OWNER: Beclawat Stable and Pereira Zona L
ENTRY.COMMENT: forced pace, dueled turn, vied stretch, good effort

ENTRY.NAME: Cedar Valley
ENTRY.COMMENT: reared start, moved up turn, 7-path stretch, empty

ENTRY.NAME: Honey Girl
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pace, slim lead turn, 4-path stretch, outfinished

ENTRY.NAME: Tickle Her Toe
ENTRY.COMMENT: in touch, facor turn, 5-path stretch, fought gamely

ENTRY.NAME: Smarty Illusion
ENTRY.OWNER: Cunningham, Walter E. and Pion, Terri L.
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled off pace, evenly turn, 6-path stretch, needed more

RACE.RACE_TEXT: FORT ERIE RACE 4 1M 70Y Dirt CR: 69. Claiming Purse 13500. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race At a Mile or Over Since September 16 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $4,000 (Colts And Geldings Preferred)(*Plus Up To $540 Ont ario Bred/Ontario Sired Breeders Awards).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: QUIET REBEL was well back early, closed the gap on the far turn and from the eight path at the top of the stretch drew off. FIFTH SEASON was unhurried early, gained ground on the far turn and from the six path at the top of the stretch finished well. SENSING HOLIDAY was in touch and had the lead on the far turn but from the three path at the top of the stretch failed to hold. STRONG ATTITUDE set the pace but was headed on the far turn and from the three path at the top of the stretch had nothing left. TWO YEAR CONTRACT was in range and saved ground on the far turn but from the six path at the top of the stretch was no real threat. DR CHAPPELL was off the pace and hustled along on the far turn but dropped back through the stretch. BROADWAY RUCKUS stalked the early leader but lost ground on the far turn, was pulled up at the top of the stretch and walked off.

ENTRY.NAME: Sensing Holiday
ENTRY.COMMENT: in touch, led far turn, 3-path stretch, failed to hold

ENTRY.NAME: Broadway Ruckus
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked leader early, lost ground far turn, pulled up top stretch

ENTRY.NAME: Quiet Rebel
ENTRY.COMMENT: well back, closed gap far turn, 8-path stretch, drew off

ENTRY.NAME: Fifth Season
ENTRY.COMMENT: unhurried, gained ground far turn, 6-path stretch, finished well

ENTRY.NAME: Two Year Contract
ENTRY.COMMENT: in range, saved ground far turn, 6-path stretch, no real threat

ENTRY.NAME: Dr Chappell
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace, hustled along far turn, dropped back stretch

ENTRY.NAME: Strong Attitude
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pace, headed far turn, 3-path stretch, nothing left

RACE.RACE_TEXT: FORT ERIE RACE 5 1 1/16M Dirt CR: 66. Claiming Purse 15750. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race At A Mile Or Over Since September 16 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,750, allowed 2 lbs. (Ra ces Where Entered For $4,000 Or Less Not Considered In Allowances) (*Plus Up To $540 Ontario Bred/Ontario Sired Breeders Awards).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: DONNARUMMA stalked the early leader, was a factor on the far turn and from the five path at the top of the stretch was kept to task. MANITOULIN ISLAND was hustled early and had a clear lead on the far turn but from the three path at the top of the stretch was second best. SECRET SUNSHINE was settled off the pace, hustled along on the far turn and from the four path at the top of the stretch was up for show. ZIPPITY DAY was in touch and roused on the far turn but from the six path at the top of the stretch had no response. FLAT OUT ANGEL was in range and saved ground on the far turn but had no late kick. HONEYS DIAMOND had no speed, trailed the field on the far turn, was pulled up in mid stretch and walked off.

ENTRY.NAME: Flat Out Angel
ENTRY.COMMENT: in range, saved ground far turn, no late kick

ENTRY.NAME: Donnarumma
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked leader, factor far turn, 5-path stretch, kept to task

ENTRY.NAME: Manitoulin Island
ENTRY.COMMENT: hustled early, clear lead far turn, 3-path stretch, 2nd best

ENTRY.NAME: Zippity Day
ENTRY.COMMENT: in touch, roused far turn, 6-path stretch, no response

ENTRY.NAME: Secret Sunshine
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled, hustled along far turn, 4-path stretch, up for show

ENTRY.NAME: Honeys Diamond
ENTRY.COMMENT: no speed, trailed far turn, pulled up stretch, walked off

RACE.RACE_TEXT: FORT ERIE RACE 6 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 90. Allowance Purse 24600. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Other Than Maiden Or Claiming Since September 16 Allowed 2 lbs. (Colts And Geldings Preferred)(*Plus Up To $4,725 Ontario Bred/Ontario Sired Breeders Awards).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: VICTORY MARCH settled off the pace, moved up on the turn and from the six path at the top of the stretch drew clear. STRONG ENDING was unhurried early, roused from the inside on the turn and from the four path at the top of the stretch was up for place. STRIKING MOON stalked the early leaders and was a factor on the turn but from the five path at the top of the stretch evened out. HAPPYMAC forced the early pace and had a slim lead on the turn but from the three path at the top of the stretch gave way. VINNIE VAN GO set the pace and dueled on the turn but came up empty. HALF LIT was off the pace and showed little in a dull effort.

ENTRY.COMMENT: set pace, dueled turn, came up empty

ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked leaders, factor turn, 5-path stretch, evened out

ENTRY.NAME: Happymac
ENTRY.COMMENT: forced pace, slim lead turn, 3-path stretch, gave way

ENTRY.NAME: Victory March
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled off pace, moved up turn, 6-path stretch, drew clear

RACE.RACE_TEXT: FORT ERIE RACE 7 1 1/16M Dirt CR: 69. Claiming Purse 19800. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON TWO RACES IN 2023. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race At a Mile or Over Since September 16 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $6,250, if for $6,000, allowed 2 lb s. (Races Where Entered For $5,000 Or Less Not Considered In Eligibility) (*Plus Up To $540 Ontario Bred/Ontario Sired Breeders Awards).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: LITTLE FIRE was well back, had a mild gain on the far turn and from the four path at the top of the stretch was up in time. IPSUM GRATUS stalked the early leaders from the outside and had a clear lead on the far turn but from the three path at the top of the stretch was caught late. ORBITING THE SKY was unhurried early and a factor on the far turn but from the five path at the top of the stretch needed more. AWILDAS TREASURE forced the early pace but chased on the far turn and had nothing left. DOODLE DANDY was off the pace, trailed the field on the far turn and failed to fire. REMEMBEROLDTYMES set a pressured pace but lost ground on the far turn and was empty.

ENTRY.COMMENT: set pressured pace, lost ground far turn, empty

ENTRY.OWNER: Hoad Lindsey L and Hoad Joseph B

ENTRY.COMMENT: unhurried, factor far turn, 5-path stretch, needed more

ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked outside, clear lead far turn, 3-path stretch, caught late

RACE.RACE_TEXT: FORT ERIE RACE 8 5F Dirt CR: 77. Claiming Purse 22200. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD THREE YEAR OLDS, 120 LBS.; OLDER, 124 LBS. Non-winners Of A Race Since September 16 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $8,000, if for $7,000, allowed 2 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $6,250 Or Less Not Consider ed In Allowances)(Limited To 10 Starters). (*Plus Up To $540 Ontario Bred/Ontario Sired Breeders Awards). If deemed inadvisable by management to run on the turf, this race will be run at a distance of Five Furlongs on the main track.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: SNELL FLICKA was hustled early, forced the pace on the turn and from the five path at the top of the stretch was much the best. MUSICAL RIDE was off the pace, trailed the field on the turn and rallied late. SOMEONE ELSE was in touch, hustled along on the turn and from the four path at the top of the stretch finished evenly. HASN'T HIT ME YET stalked the early leaders and raced evenly on the turn but leveled off. SILVER TUNES was in range and roused on the turn but from the seven path at the top of the stretch had no response. DETERMINED LOVE set a pressured pace and had a slim lead on the turn but dropped back through the stretch.

ENTRY.NAME: Hasn't Hit Me Yet
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked leaders, evenly turn, leveled off

ENTRY.NAME: Determined Love
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pressured pace, slim lead turn, dropped back stretch

ENTRY.NAME: Snell Flicka
ENTRY.COMMENT: hustled early, forced pace turn, 5-path stretch, much the best

ENTRY.COMMENT: in touch, hustled along turn, 4-path stretch, finished evenly
